data.body: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.body: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
data.author: Seneca

data.body: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
data.author: Epictetus

data.body: The best answer to anger is silence.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.body: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
data.author: Seneca

data.body: They lose the day in expectation of the night, and the night in fear of the dawn.
data.author: Seneca

data.body: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
data.author: Zeno

data.body: No man is free who is not master of himself.
data.author: Epictetus

data.body: How ridiculous and how strange to be surprised at anything which happens in life.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.body: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius
